headline: This $125M Israeli Startup Is Building The World's First Cataract Robot To Solve A Global Crisis: 'There Is No Human Way To Close The Gap'
summary: ForSight Robotics, an Israeli startup aiming to automate cataract and eye surgery, announced Tuesday that it raised $125 million to expand its precision robotics platform, Oryom. The round was led by Eclipse Ventures, with participation from surgical robotics legend Fred Moll, co-founder of Intuitive Surgical, and Moshe Shoham, a Technion professor and pioneer behind multiple robotics companies including Mazor, which was acquired by Medtronic for $1.6 billion, Forbes reports. headline: Intuitive Surgical (NasdaqGS:ISRG) Expands Da Vinci Surgical System Presence In European Market
summary: Intuitive Surgical (NasdaqGS:ISRG) recently secured CE Mark approval for its da Vinci 5 Surgical System, enabling advanced robotic-assisted surgical procedures in Europe. This positive development aligns with the company's strategic push to enhance surgical technology. Over the last quarter, Intuitive's stock price increased by 9%, a movement that broadly aligns with market trends, where the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite experienced upward momentum, with notable gains in the tech sector. headline: Intuitive’s da Vinci 5 Surgical System Receives CE Mark
summary: Fifth-generation da Vinci surgical system approved for use in Europe across multiple proceduresSUNNYVALE, Calif., July 02, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Intuitive (NASDAQ:ISRG), a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and the pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery, announced today that the da Vinci 5 Surgical System has received CE mark approval for adult and pediatric use in Europe for minimally invasive endoscopic procedures across abdominopelvic and thoracoscopic surgical procedures, in

headline: Intuitive Surgical’s da Vinci 5 robot wins CE mark
summary: The robotics giant’s most advanced soft tissue surgical system is now available for use in Europe across a range of procedures.
